Home.Title: Home
Cancel.Confirm.Title: Cancel
Cancel.Confirm.Message: All configurations will be lost after returning to the home page. Are you sure you want to return to the home page.
Reset.Confirm.Title: Reset Data
Reset.Confirm.Message: Do you want to abandon the current modification and return to the init state?
Params.MariaDBIp.Description: The IP of the node where the MariaDB (MySQL) or Postgress server process is running. Current version uses same names for both DB servers.
Params.MariaDBPort.Description: Port in which the server accepts the connections.
Params.MariaDBUser.Description: MariaDB user that the services will use. Needs INSERT/SELECT privileges. Used by EARDBD.
Params.MariaDBPassw.Description: Password for the previous user. If left blank or commented it will assume the user has no password.
Params.MariaDBCommandsUser.Description: MariaDB user that the commands (eacct, ereport) will use. Only uses SELECT privileges.
Params.MariaDBCommandsPassw.Description: Password for the previous user. If left blank or commented it will assume the user has no password.
Params.MariaDBDatabase.Description: Name of EAR's database in the server.
Params.MaxConnections.Description: Maximum number of connections of the commands user to prevent server saturation/malicious actuation. Applies to MariaDBCommandsUser
Params.ReportNodeDetail.Description: Extended node information reported to database (added: temperature and avg_freq in power monitoring).
Params.ReportSigDetail.Description: Extended signature hardware counters reported to database.
Params.ReportLoops.Description: Set to 1 if you want Loop signatures to be reported to database.
Params.NodeDaemonPort.Description: The port where the EARD will be listening.
Params.NodeDaemonPowermonFreq.Descriptio: Frequency used by power monitoring service, in seconds.
Params.NodeDaemonMaxPstate.Description: Maximum supported frequency (1 means nominal, no turbo).
Params.NodeDaemonTurbo.Description: Enable (1) or disable (0) the turbo frequency.
Params.NodeUseDB.Description: Enables the use of the database.
Params.NodeUseEARDBD.Description: Inserts data to MySQL by sending that data to the EARDBD (1) or directly (0).
Params.NodeForceFrequencies.Description: '1' means EAR is controlling frequencies at all times (targeted to production systems) and 0 means EAR will not change the frequencies when users are not using EAR library (targeted to benchmarking systems).
Params.NodeUseLog.Description: When set to 1, the output is saved in '$EAR_TMP'/eard.log (common configuration) as a log file.Otherwsie, stderr is used.
Params.MinTimePerformanceAccuracy.Descri: Minimum time between two energy readings for performance accuracy
Params.DBDaemonPortTCP.Description: Port where the EARDBD server is listening
Params.DBDaemonPortSecTCP.Description: Port where the EARDBD mirror is listening
Params.DBDaemonSyncPort.Description: Port is used to synchronize the server and mirror
Params.DBDaemonAggregationTime.Descripti: In seconds, interval of time of accumulating data to generate an energy aggregation
Params.DBDaemonInsertionTime.Description: In seconds, time between inserts of the buffered data
Params.DBDaemonMemorySize.Description: Memory allocated per process. This allocations is used for buffering the data sent to the database by EARD or other components. If there is a server and mirror in a node a double of that value will be allocated. It is expressed in MegaBytes.
Params.DBDaemonMemorySizePerType.Descrip: The percentage of the memory buffer used by the previous field, by each type. These types are: mpi, non-mpi and learning applications, loops, energy metrics and aggregations and events, in that order. If a type gets 0% of space, this metric is discarded and not saved into the database.
Params.DBDaemonUseLog.Description: When set to 1, eardbd uses a '$EAR_TMP'/eardbd.log file as a log file
Params.CoefficientsDir.Description: Path where coefficients are installed, usually $EAR_ETC/ear/coeffs
Params.DynAISLevels.Description: Number of levels used by DynAIS algorithm.
Params.DynAISWindowSize.Description: Windows size used by DynAIS, the higher the size the higher the overhead.
Params.DynaisTimeout.Description: Maximum time in seconds that EAR will wait until a signature is computed. After this value, if no signature is computed, EAR will go to periodic mode.
Params.LibraryPeriod.Description: Time in seconds to compute every application signature when the EAR goes to periodic mode.
Params.CheckEARModeEvery.Description: Number of MPI calls whether EAR must go to periodic mode or not.
Params.GlobalManagerHost.Description: The IP or hostname of the node where the EARGMD demon is running.
Params.GlobalManagerPort.Description: Port where EARGMD will be listening.
Params.GlobalManagerUseAggregated.Descri: Use '1' or not '0' aggregated metrics to compute total energy.
Params.GlobalManagerPeriodT1.Description: Period T1 and period T2 are specified in seconds. T1 must be less than T2. Global manager updates the information every T1 seconds and uses the energy/power in T2 period to estimate energy/power constraints
Params.GlobalManagerPeriodT2.Description: Period T1 and period T2 are specified in seconds. T1 must be less than T2. Global manager updates the information every T1 seconds and uses the energy/power in T2 period to estimate energy/power constraints
Params.GlobalManagerUnits.Description: Units field, Can be '-' (Joules), 'K' KiloJoules or 'M' MegaJoules
Params.GlobalManagerEnergyLimit.Descript: This limit means the maximum energy allowed in 259200 seconds in 550000 KJoules
Params.GlobalManagerMode.Description: Global manager modes. Two modes are supported '0' (manual) or '1' (automatic). Manual means Gobal Manager is only monitoring energy&power and reporting to the DB . Automatic means it takes actions to guarantee energy limits.
Params.GlobalManagerMail.Description: A mail can be sent reporting the warning level (and the action taken in automatic mode). 'nomail' means no mail is sent. This option is independent of the node.
Params.GlobalManagerWarningsPerc.Descrip: Percentage of accumulated energy to start the warning DEFCON level L4, L3 and L2.
Params.GlobalManagerGracePeriods.Descrip: Number of 'grace' T1 periods before doing a new re-evaluation. After a warning, EARGM will wait T1xGlobalManagerGracePeriods seconds until it raises a new warning.
Params.GlobalManagerUseLog.Description: When set to 1, the output is saved in '$EAR_TMP'/eargmd.log (common configuration) as a log file.
Params.TmpDir.Description: Path used for communication files, shared memory, etc. It must be PRIVATE per compute node and with read/write permissions. $EAR_TMP
Params.EtcDir.Description: Path where coefficients and configuration are stored. It must be readable in all compute nodes. $EAR_ETC
Params.InstDir.Description: Path where coefficients and configuration are stored. It must be readable in all compute nodes. $EAR_ETC
Params.DataBasePathName.Description: Path where metrics are generated in text files when no database is installed. A suffix is included.
Params.DefaultPowerPolicy.Description: Policy names must be exactly file names for policies installed in the system at /path/to/inst/lib/plugins/policies (without the extension .so ).
Params.Policy.Description: Example of the definition of 3 policies with different configurations: It must be included policy name, default frequency, privileged means whether normal users can execute or nor. Settings depends on policy.
Params.PluginEnergy.Description: Energy reading plugin (without the extension). Allows to use different system components to read the energy of the node. In this case, this plugin reads the energy of the system using Intel Node Manager. look at /path/to/inst/lib/plugins/energy folder to see the list of installed energy plugins
Params.PluginPowerModel.Description: Power model plugin (without the extension). The power model plugin is used to predict the power and energy consumption of the next iteration of the executing application.
Params.AuthorizedUsers.Description: Authorized users that are allowed to change policies, thresholds and frequencies are supposed to be administrators. A list of users, Linux groups, and/or SLURM accounts can be provided to allow normal users to perform that actions. Only normal Authorized users can execute the learning phase.
Params.AuthorizedAccounts.Description: Authorized users that are allowed to change policies, thresholds and frequencies are supposed to be administrators. A list of users, Linux groups, and/or SLURM accounts can be provided to allow normal users to perform that actions. Only normal Authorized users can execute the learning phase.
Params.AuthorizedGroups.Description: Authorized users that are allowed to change policies, thresholds and frequencies are supposed to be administrators. A list of users, Linux groups, and/or SLURM accounts can be provided to allow normal users to perform that actions. Only normal Authorized users can execute the learning phase.
Params.EnergyTag.Description: Energy tags are pre-defined configurations for some applications (EAR library is not loaded). This energy tags accept a user ids, groups and SLURM accounts of users allowed to use that tag.
Params.SpecialNodes.Description: Describes nodes with some special characteristic such as different default P_STATEs, default coefficients file and/or policy thresholds.
Params.Island.Description:
This section is mandatory since it is used for cluster description. Normally nodes are grouped in islands that share the same hardware characteristics as well as its database managers (EARDBDS). Each line describes an island, and every node must be in an island.
 
Remember that there are two kinds of database daemons. One called 'server' and other one called 'mirror'. Both performs the metrics buffering process, but just one performs the insert. The mirror will do that insert in case the 'server' process crashes or the node fails.
 
It is recommended for all islands to have symmetry. For example, if the island I0 and I1 have the server N0 and the mirror N1, the next island would have to point the same N0 and N1 or point to new ones N2 and N3.
 
Multiple EARDBDs are supported in the same island, so more than one line per island is required, but the condition of symmetry have to be met.
 
It is recommended that for a island to the server and the mirror running in different nodes. However, the EARDBD program could be both server and mirror at the same time. This means that the islands I0 and I1 could have the N0 server and the N2 mirror, and the islands I2 and I3 the N2 server and N0 mirror, fulfilling the symmetry requirements.
 
The min_power, max_power and max_temp are threshold values that determine if the metrics read might be invalid, and a warning message to syslog will be reported if the values are outside of said thresholds. error_power is a more extreme value that if a metric surpasses it, said metric will not be reported to database.
Params.Model.Add.Title: Add {value} params
Preview.Dialog.Title: Preview ear.conf
